summary: This document contains Ghislaine Maxwell's U.S. naturalization application (Form N-400) approved in 2002, along with earlier immigration forms (I-485 adjustment of status from 1995 and I-131 travel document applications). It provides detailed personal, employment, travel, and background information about Maxwell, including her address at Little St. James Island and her employment with J. Epstein & Co.

persons.name: Ghislaine Noelle Maxwell
persons.context: The primary subject of the immigration forms, applying for U.S. citizenship. The documents list her personal details, employment history, travel, and addresses.

persons.name: J. Epstein
persons.context: Listed as Maxwell's employer at 'J. Epstein & Co.' at 457 Madison Ave., NY, NY from 01/1993 to 12/2000, where she worked as a manager.

persons.name: Dorothea Bertrand
persons.context: INS official who witnessed and signed Maxwell's naturalization application oath on August 29, 2002.

persons.name: Elizabeth
persons.context: Listed as Ghislaine Maxwell's mother's first name on Form I-485.

persons.name: Robert
persons.context: Listed as Ghislaine Maxwell's father's first name on Form I-485.

connections.description: Maxwell listed J. Epstein & Co. as her employer from January 1993 to December 2000, working as a manager.

events.title: Naturalization Application Approved
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's Application for Naturalization (Form N-400) was approved by the District Director.

events.title: Adjustment of Status Application Received
events.description: Maxwell's Form I-485 (Application to Register Permanent Residence or Adjust Status) was received by the Immigration and Naturalization Service in New York.

events.title: Travel Document Application Received
events.description: Maxwell's Application for Travel Document (Form I-131) was received by INS, seeking advance parole for travel.

events.title: Became Lawful Permanent Resident

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell listed her home address as 115Â° Little St. James Island, St. Thomas, USVI on her 2002 naturalization application, directly linking her to Epstein's private island.
Maxwell was employed as a manager at 'J. Epstein & Co.' at 457 Madison Ave., NY from January 1993 to December 2000.
Between 1997-2002, Maxwell took 39 trips outside the United States totaling 253 days, traveling frequently to France, Italy, and the United Kingdom.
Maxwell's naturalization application was approved on August 29, 2002, making her a U.S. citizen.
On her immigration forms, Maxwell answered 'No' to all criminal and moral character questions, including questions about prostitution, drug trafficking, and crimes.
